text.listBibl:
References
[1] M. Fierz and W. Pauli, " On relativistic wave equations for par-
ticles of arbitrary spin in an electromagnetic field, " Proceedings
of the Royal Society of London A, vol. 173, no. 953, pp. 211–232,
1939.
[2] H. van Dam and M. Veltman, " Massive and mass-less Yang-
Mills and gravitational fields, " Nuclear Physics B, vol. 22, no. 2,
pp. 397–411, 1970.
[3] V. I. Zakharov, " Linearized gravitation theory and the graviton
mass, " JETP Letters, vol. 12, p. 312, 1970.
[4] A. I. Vainshtein, " To the problem of nonvanishing gravitation
mass, " Physics Letters B, vol. 39, no. 3, pp. 393–394, 1972.
[5] D. G. Boulware and S. Deser, " Can gravitation have a finite
range? " Physical Review D, vol. 6, no. 12, pp. 3368–3382, 1972.
[6] C. de Rham and G. Gabadadze, " Generalization of the Fierz-
Pauli action, " Physical Review D, vol. 82, no. 4, Article ID
044020, 9 pages, 2010.
[7] C. De Rham, G. Gabadadze, and A. J. Tolley, " Resummation of
massive gravity, " Physical Review Letters, vol. 106, no. 23, Article
ID 231101, 2011.
[8] A. De Felice, A. E. Gümrükçüo˘ glu, and S. Mukohyama,
" Massive gravity: nonlinear instability of a homogeneous and
isotropic universe, " Physical Review Letters, vol. 109, no. 17,
Article ID 171101, 4 pages, 2012.
[9] D. Comelli, F. Nesti, and L. Pilo, " Massive gravity: a general
analysis, " Journal of High Energy Physics, vol. 2013, article 161,
2013.
[10] H. Weyl, Spacetime Matter, Dover, New York, NY, USA, 1952.
[11] P. A. M. Dirac, " Long range forces and broken symmetries, "
Proceedings of the Royal Society Series A: Mathematical and
Physical Sciences, vol. 333, no. 1595, pp. 403–418, 1973.
[12] P. D. Mannheim and D. Kazanas, " Exact vacuum solution
to conformal Weyl gravity and galactic rotation curves, " The
Astrophysical Journal, vol. 342, no. 2, pp. 635–638, 1989.
[13] D. Kazanas and P. D. Mannheim, " General structure of the
gravitational equations of motion in conformal Weyl gravity, "
Astrophysical Journal Supplement Series, vol. 76, pp. 431–453,
1991.
[14] P. D. Mannheim, " Alternatives to dark matter and dark energy, "
Progress in Particle and Nuclear Physics, vol. 56, pp. 340–445,
2006.
[15] Y. Fujii and K.-I. Maeda, The Scalar-Tensor Theory of Gravita-
tion, Cambridge University Press, Cambridge, UK, 2003.
[16] G. T. Hooft, " Local conformal symmetry: the missing symmetry
component for space and time, " http://arxiv.org/abs/1410.6675.
[17] C. M. Bender and P. D. Mannheim, " No-ghost theorem for
the fourth-order derivative Pais-Uhlenbeck oscillator model, "
Physical Review Letters, vol. 100, Article ID 110402, 2008.
[18] J. Wood and W. Moreau, " Solutions of conformal grav-
ity with dynamical mass generation in the solar system, "
http://arxiv.org/abs/gr-qc/0102056.
[19] R. H. Sanders, " Anti-gravity and galaxy rotation curves, " Astron-
omy & Astrophysics, vol. 136, p. L21, 1984.
[20] E. Griv and V. V. Zhytnikov, " Simulations of stellar disks in
galaxies with non-Newtonian interactions, " Astrophysics and
Space Science, vol. 226, no. 1, pp. 51–72, 1995.
[21] ´
E. ´
E. Flanagan, " Fourth order Weyl gravity, " Physical Review D,
vol. 74, Article ID 023002, 2006.
[22] P. D. Mannheim, " Schwarzschild limit of conformal gravity in
the presence of macroscopic scalar fields, " Physical Review D
Particles, Fields, Gravitation, and Cosmology, vol. 75, no. 12,
Article ID 124006, 2007.
